doc:
Jessica Harcourt https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jessica_Harcourt 0 Jessica Harcourt (1906–1988) was an Australian model, author and actor, best known for playing a leading role in For the Term of His Natural Life (1927). As a young woman her beauty attracted the attention of a representative of J.C. Williamson Ltd and she became a chorus girl. She later worked as a fashion model and after making her cinema debut as Sara Purfoy in For the Term of His Natural Life, appeared in The Adorable Outcast (1928) and The Russell Affair (1929). Sir John Longstaff painted several portraits of her, one of which hung in the National Gallery. During the 1930s, Harcourt also wrote newspaper articles, had her own cosmetics line and produced a number of fashion shows. In 1938 she married the famous Australian author F. J. Thwaites and retired from acting. She and Thwaites had two children and remained married until his death in 1979. In 1981 she appeared at the premiere of the restoration of For the Term of His Natural Life. Jessica_Harcourt ( 1906 – 1988 ) was an_Australian_model_,_author_and_actor , best_known for playing a_leading_role in For the_Term of His_Natural_Life ( 1927 ) . As a_young_woman her_beauty attracted the_attention of a_representative of J.C._Williamson_Ltd and she became a_chorus_girl . She later worked as a_fashion_model and after making her_cinema_debut as Sara_Purfoy in For the_Term of His_Natural_Life , appeared in The_Adorable_Outcast_(_1928_) and The_Russell_Affair_(_1929_) . Sir_John_Longstaff painted several_portraits of her , one of which hung in the_National_Gallery . During the_1930s , Harcourt also wrote newspaper_articles , had her_own_cosmetics_line and produced a_number of fashion_shows . In 1938 she married the_famous_Australian_author_F._J._Thwaites and retired from acting . She and Thwaites had two_children and remained married until his_death in 1979 . In 1981 she appeared at the_premiere of the_restoration of_For the_Term of His_Natural_Life .
